title: Linux Service Management
description: How to start, stop, and troubleshoot system services (systemd) on Linux.

steps.title: Check Service Status
steps.instruction: Run 'sudo systemctl status <service_name>'. Look for 'Active: failed' and the last few lines of error logs.

steps.title: Restart the Service
steps.instruction: Run 'sudo systemctl restart <service_name>'. This is the quickest fix for frozen or hung backend processes.

steps.title: View Detailed Logs
steps.instruction: Run 'sudo journalctl -u <service_name> -e'. This gives you the full error history specifically for that service.

steps.title: Check for Port Conflicts
steps.instruction: If a web service fails: 'sudo netstat -tulpn | grep <port_number>'. Ensure another app isn't already using the required port.

steps.title: Validate Config Files
steps.instruction: Many services (like Nginx or Docker) have a test command: 'sudo nginx -t'. Use it to check for syntax errors in your configurations.
